body.p: Dear Sir I have a company of forty men, organized for the state guard all of them stout healthy men, and I wish youto know if you will accept and arm them. They are as fine a company of men as old mercer can raise. will you please to let me know as soon as it is convenient whether you will accept them or not. The people are tolerably quiet in this section of country. very little excitement, trade of all kinds dull, Crops looking admirably well.

I remain respectfully
Yours
Abm. G. Smith

A. G. Smith
Harrodsburg
State Guard
